adjectives.description: swimmy (comparative more swimmy, superlative most swimmy)

entries.meaning: Dizzy; swirling or moving as if seen in a daze.
examples: It was as well I was sitting down; the experience of dizziness induced by a familial revelation did not seem to be a condition I was becoming inured to, despite the frequency with which it had swept through me in the past few days. My sight seemed to go a bit swimmy for a while, but I just sat and waited for it to clear.

entries.meaning: An inflatable armband to help children swim.
